intro: Daphnopsis bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá daphnopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
